title: Programming
description: This is a step-by-step tutorial to introduce to programming in the Javascript language. We will start with some definitions.

contents.title: What is a program?
contents.description:
A program is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do.
The computer can understand a set of instructions (machine language), but these instructions are often too complicated to understand for humans.
In the other hand, human languages are too ambiguous and difficult to understand for a computer.

contents.title: What is programming?
contents.description: Programming is the way to give instructions to a computer. We can write computer programs in programming languages specially designed for computers.

contents.title: What is a programming language?
contents.description:
A programming language is a set of human-readable instructions (commands) that could be translated to machine language.
There are many programming languages, for example, Javascript, Python, C, Java and others.
The main differences between programming languages are their syntax and special keywords.

contents.title: Interpreters
contents.description:
An interpreter is able to receive a set of instructions (program code), load, translate and run the program immediately.
Since the program code is translated on the fly, if at some point the loaded program have syntax errors, the interpreter stops the execution.
If an unexpected error ocurrs while running the program (run-time error), the program will fail and terminate.
Main features:
  • The program code could run in any machine, if an interpreter is available
  • The program is ready to run immediately (simplified analysis and optimization)
  • By using an intermediary program as interpreter, the execution performance could be lower than a compiled program.

contents.title: Compilers
contents.description:
A compiler can process a set of program files, to verify and translate the code (compilation) into machine language. The result is an executable program file.
If the code contains errors or invalid syntax (compile-time error), the compilation fails and no executable program is created.
If an unexpected error ocurrs during the execution of the compiled program (run-rime error), the program is terminated.
Main features:
  • The resulting executable program will run in specific machines wich understands the machine code (system specific)
  • The compilation process could take additional time to analyze, check, optimize and translate the program.
  • There is no intermediary. Once compiled, the program could run faster than interpreted programs.
